subject: Sleep
title: Bipolar Depression and Sleep
description: A micro-lesson that makes Bipolar Depression and Sleep usable.

hook.text: The same person who couldn't sleep for three days during mania now sleeps 14 hours during depression. The pendulum swings hard.

buildup.text: Bipolar depression often features extreme hypersomnia, with patients sleeping 12 or more hours daily.

discovery.text: The shift from insomnia to hypersomnia is driven by the same neurotransmitter systems swinging between extremes.

twist.text: Monitoring sleep duration is one of the most reliable early warning signs for mood episode shifts in bipolar patients.

climax.text: Sleep diaries and wearable trackers are now used clinically to predict and prevent mood episodes before they hit.

punchline.text: In bipolar disorder, your sleep pattern predicts your mood before you feel it.

quiz.question: Why is sleep monitoring important in bipolar disorder?
options: Changes in sleep duration predict mood episode shifts
